member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The column where the anchor is placed.
The row where the anchor is placed.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class which references default () style from the specified workbook.
member.param: The workbook from which default () style this inherits formatting.

summary.para: Gets or sets the borders.
If set to , borders will be resolved from referenced workbook style.
Gets or sets the fill (cell background).
If set to , fill will be resolved from referenced workbook style.
Fill can be either pattern or gradient.
Gradient fill is currently supported in XLSX and partially in rendering formats (PDF, XPS and image formats).
Gets or sets the font.
If set to , font will be resolved from referenced workbook style.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the contents of the cell will not be displayed in the formula bar.
Default value is .
Gets or sets the horizontal alignment.
Default value is .

member.name: P:GemBox.Spreadsheet.CellStyle.Indent

summary.para: Gets or sets the number of spaces (of the style font) of indentation for text in a cell.
The number of spaces to indent is calculated as following: Number of spaces to indent = * 3.
Default value is 0.

member.exception: Value must be greater than or equal to 0.

member.name: P:GemBox.Spreadsheet.CellStyle.IsDefault
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the referenced workbook style is default () and there are no additional modifications of cell formatting.

summary.para: Gets or sets a value indicating whether text orientation is vertical.
Default value is .
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the cell is locked.
Default value is .
If is workbook , gets or sets the name of the style; otherwise, gets the name of the referenced workbook from which this inherits formatting.
Default value is Normal.
Gets or sets the number format which indicates how to format and render the numeric value of a cell.
Default value is General.
If set to , number format will be resolved from referenced workbook style.

member.name: P:GemBox.Spreadsheet.CellStyle.NumberFormatLocal
member.summary: Gets a that represents the format code for the numeric value in the language of the user.

summary.para: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the text string in a cell should be prefixed by a single quote mark (e.g., 'text). Use it to store numeric value of a cell as text.
Default value is .

member.name: P:GemBox.Spreadsheet.CellStyle.Rotation

summary.para: Gets or sets the text rotation in degrees (1/360th of a full circle).
Value must be between -90 and 90 and specifies counterclockwise rotation of the text from the normal position. The first letter of the text is considered the center-point of the arc.
Default value is 0.
This member is currently not supported in PDF, XPS and image file formats.

member.exception: Value must be between -90 and 90.

summary.para: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the displayed text in the cell should be shrunk to fit the cell width. Not applicable when a cell contains multiple lines of text.
Default value is .

summary.para: Represents a group of s.
Each instance that has the same date/time components (year, month, day, hour, minute, second) as this up to belongs to this group.
Instance of can be inserted into collection to enable filtering values.

summary.para: Represents the style of fill pattern being used for a cell format.
Currently supported only in XLS and XLSX. For all other formats it defaults to either or .
The fill style is none (no fill).
When and/or are specified, a pattern of overrides them and means the cell has no fill.
The fill style is solid.
When solid is specified, the is the only color rendered, even when a is also specified.

summary.para: Represents a shading style and variant of a gradient fill effect.
Gradient fill is currently supported in XLSX and partially in rendering formats (PDF, XPS and image formats).

member.name: F:GemBox.Spreadsheet.GradientShadingStyle.None
member.summary: Cell doesn't have any gradient fill effect.

member.name: F:GemBox.Spreadsheet.GradientShadingStyle.HorizontalHigh
member.summary: Linear gradient where the first color starts at the top side of the cell and blends horizontally with the second color which starts at the bottom side of the cell [1 - 2].

member.name: F:GemBox.Spreadsheet.GradientShadingStyle.HorizontalLow
member.summary: Linear gradient where the first color starts at the bottom side of the cell and blends horizontally with the second color which starts at the top side of the cell [2 - 1].

member.name: F:GemBox.Spreadsheet.GradientShadingStyle.Horizontal
member.summary: Linear gradient where the first color starts at the top and bottom sides of the cell and blends horizontally with the second color which starts in the middle of the cell [1 - 2 - 1].

member.name: F:GemBox.Spreadsheet.GradientShadingStyle.VerticalLow
member.summary: Linear gradient where the first color starts at the left side of the cell and blends vertically with the second color which starts at the right side of the cell [1 | 2].

member.name: F:GemBox.Spreadsheet.GradientShadingStyle.VerticalHigh
member.summary: Linear gradient where the first color starts at the right side of the cell and blends vertically with the second color which starts at the left side of the cell [2 | 1].

member.name: F:GemBox.Spreadsheet.GradientShadingStyle.Vertical
member.summary: Linear gradient where the first color starts at the left and right sides of the cell and blends vertically with the second color which starts in the middle of the cell [1 | 2 | 1].

member.name: F:GemBox.Spreadsheet.GradientShadingStyle.DiagonalUpHigh
member.summary: Linear gradient where the first color starts at the top-left corner of the cell and blends diagonally with the second color which starts at the bottom-right corner of the cell [1 / 2].

member.name: F:GemBox.Spreadsheet.GradientShadingStyle.DiagonalUpLow
member.summary: Linear gradient where the first color starts at the bottom-right corner of the cell and blends diagonally with the second color which starts at the top-left corner of the cell [2 / 1].

member.name: F:GemBox.Spreadsheet.GradientShadingStyle.DiagonalUp
member.summary: Linear gradient where the first color starts at the top-left and bottom-right corners of the cell and blends diagonally with the second color which starts in the middle of the cell [1 / 2 / 1].

member.name: F:GemBox.Spreadsheet.GradientShadingStyle.DiagonalDownHigh
member.summary: Linear gradient where the first color starts at the top-right corner of the cell and blends diagonally with the second color which starts at the bottom-left corner of the cell [2 \ 1].

member.name: F:GemBox.Spreadsheet.GradientShadingStyle.DiagonalDownLow
member.summary: Linear gradient where the first color starts at the bottom-left corner of the cell and blends diagonally with the second color which starts at the top-right corner of the cell [1 \ 2].

member.name: F:GemBox.Spreadsheet.GradientShadingStyle.DiagonalDown
member.summary: Linear gradient where the first color starts at the top-right and bottom-left corners of the cell and blends diagonally with the second color which starts in the middle of the cell [1 \ 2 \ 1].

member.name: F:GemBox.Spreadsheet.GradientShadingStyle.FromTopLeftCorner
member.summary: Path gradient where the first color starts at the top-left corner of the cell and blends with the second color which starts at the other corners of the cell.

member.name: F:GemBox.Spreadsheet.GradientShadingStyle.FromTopRightCorner
member.summary: Path gradient where the first color starts at the top-right corner of the cell and blends with the second color which starts at the other corners of the cell.

member.name: F:GemBox.Spreadsheet.GradientShadingStyle.FromBottomLeftCorner
member.summary: Path gradient where the first color starts at the bottom-left corner of the cell and blends with the second color which starts at the other corners of the cell.

member.name: F:GemBox.Spreadsheet.GradientShadingStyle.FromBottomRightCorner
member.summary: Path gradient where the first color starts at the bottom-right corner of the cell and blends with the second color which starts at the other corners of the cell.

member.name: F:GemBox.Spreadsheet.GradientShadingStyle.FromCenter
member.summary: Path gradient where the first color starts in the middle of the cell and blends with the second color which starts at the corners of the cell.

member.name: F:GemBox.Spreadsheet.GradientShadingStyle.Complex
member.summary: Gradient fill effect is too complex to be described with this enumeration.

member.name: T:GemBox.Spreadsheet.HorizontalAlignmentStyle
member.summary: Represents available horizontal alignment options used in member.

summary.para: The horizontal alignment is general-aligned.
Text data is left-aligned.
Numbers, dates, and times are right-aligned.
Boolean types are centered.
Changing the alignment does not change the type of data.
The horizontal alignment is left-aligned.
Aligns contents at the left edge of the cell.
If an amount is specified, the contents of the cell is indented from the left by the specified number of character spaces.
The character spaces are based on the default font and font size for the workbook ( style).

member.name: F:GemBox.Spreadsheet.HorizontalAlignmentStyle.Center
member.summary: The horizontal alignment is centered, meaning the text is centered across the cell.

member.name: F:GemBox.Spreadsheet.HorizontalAlignmentStyle.Right
member.summary: The horizontal alignment is right-aligned, meaning that cell contents are aligned at the right edge of the cell.

summary.para: Indicates that the value of the cell should be filled across the entire width of the cell.
This option is currently not supported in PDF, XPS and image file formats and defaults to .
The horizontal alignment is justified (flush left and right).
For each line of text, aligns each line of the wrapped text in a cell to the right and left (except the last line).
If no single line of text wraps in the cell, then the text is not justified.
The horizontal alignment is centered across multiple cells.
This option is currently not supported in PDF, XPS and image file formats and defaults to .
Indicates that each 'word' in each line of text inside the cell is evenly distributed across the width of the cell, with flush right and left margins.
When there is also an value to apply, both the left and right side of the cell are padded by the indent value.
A 'word' is a set of characters with no space character in them.
Two lines inside a cell are separated by a carriage return.

member.name: T:GemBox.Spreadsheet.IgnoredErrorTypes
member.summary: Represents an ignored error conditions.

member.name: F:GemBox.Spreadsheet.IgnoredErrorTypes.None
member.summary: Do not ignore any error.

member.name: F:GemBox.Spreadsheet.IgnoredErrorTypes.EvaluationError
member.summary: Ignore errors when cells contain formulas that result in an error such as '#VALUE!' or '#DIV/0!'.

summary.para: Ignore errors when cells contain a value different from a calculated column formula for tables.
In other words, for a calculated column, a cell in that column is considered to have an error if its formula is different from the calculated column formula, or doesn't contain a formula at all.

member.name: F:GemBox.Spreadsheet.IgnoredErrorTypes.TwoDigitTextYear
member.summary: Ignore errors when cells contain dates in text form with years represented as 2 digits.

member.name: F:GemBox.Spreadsheet.IgnoredErrorTypes.NumberStoredAsText
member.summary: Ignore errors when numbers are formatted as text or are preceded by an apostrophe.

summary.para: Ignore errors when a formula in a region of your worksheet differs from other formulas in the same region.

For example, if the formula in cell A1 is "=B1", and the formula in cell A3 is "=B3", but the formula in cell A2 is not "=B2" but instead "=C2", then A1 and A3 both refer to the cell one column to their right, but A2 does not and so is inconsistent with them.
Ignore errors when formulas omit certain cells in a region.
For example, if there is data in cells A1:A100 and formula contains the reference "=SUM(A1:A98)".

member.name: F:GemBox.Spreadsheet.IgnoredErrorTypes.UnlockedFormula
member.summary: Ignore errors when unlocked (editable) cells in the locked sheet contain formulas.

member.name: F:GemBox.Spreadsheet.IgnoredErrorTypes.EmptyCellReference
member.summary: Ignore errors when formulas refer to empty cells.

summary.para: Ignore errors when a cell's value in a Table does not comply with the Data Validation rules specified.
For example, when a cell's value is inconsistent with the column data type for Tables connected to SharePoint data.

member.name: F:GemBox.Spreadsheet.IgnoredErrorTypes.All
member.summary: Ignore all errors.

member.name: T:GemBox.Spreadsheet.OdsOptions
member.summary: Options specified when loading ODS files.

member.name: F:GemBox.Spreadsheet.OdsOptions.None
member.summary: Do not preserve ODS parts and ignore display values (display strings). Only parts recognized by GemBox.Spreadsheet API will be loaded. Use this if you are just loading ODS file or you don't want to preserve unrecognized ODS parts for next save.

member.name: F:GemBox.Spreadsheet.OdsOptions.PreserveKeepOpen
member.summary: Preserves unrecognized ODS parts in a way it keeps loaded file open. Use if locking of input file for reading is not a problem and you want to save RAM/CPU when working with large files.

member.name: F:GemBox.Spreadsheet.OdsOptions.PreserveMakeCopy
member.summary: Preserves unrecognized ODS parts in a way it makes a copy of input file in memory. Use if locking of input file presents a problem or you are not working with large files.

member.name: F:GemBox.Spreadsheet.OdsOptions.ReadDisplayValues
member.summary: Reads display values instead of stored values. Values in ODS are stored as value - display string pairs. Normally stored value is read but that looses number formatting. If you want to read value as formatted display string (for example, date as "Wednesday, May 5th, 2009" string), set this flag.

member.summary: The vertical alignment is aligned-to-bottom.

summary.para: When text direction is horizontal: the vertical alignment of lines of text is distributed vertically, where each line of text inside the cell is evenly distributed across the height of the cell, with flush top and bottom margins.

When text direction is vertical: similar behavior as horizontal justification. The alignment is justified (flush top and bottom in this case). For each line of text, each line of the wrapped text in a cell is aligned to the top and bottom (except the last line). If no single line of text wraps in the cell, then the text is not justified.
This option is currently not supported in PDF, XPS and image file formats and defaults to .

When text direction is horizontal: the vertical alignment of lines of text is distributed vertically, where each line of text inside the cell is evenly distributed across the height of the cell, with flush top and bottom margins.

When text direction is vertical: behaves exactly as distributed horizontal alignment. The first words in a line of text (appearing at the top of the cell) are flush with the top edge of the cell, and the last words of a line of text are flush with the bottom edge of the cell, and the line of text is distributed evenly from top to bottom.
This option is currently not supported in PDF, XPS and image file formats and defaults to .
